meanings.definition: Capable of being moved or transferred from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The puzzle pieces were transposable, allowing the children to easily switch them around.
meanings.sent2: The furniture in the room was transposable, so we could change the layout whenever we wanted.
meanings.sent3: The transposable chairs made the classroom look like a musical chairs game.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were as transposable as a jigsaw puzzle, constantly shifting and rearranging.
meanings.sent5: The transposable clouds in the sky seemed to dance and change shape with the wind.

meanings.definition: Able to be rearranged or repositioned.
meanings.sent1: The flexible schedule was transposable, allowing her to adjust it based on her needs.
meanings.sent2: The transposable elements of the board game made it exciting to play over and over.
meanings.sent3: The transposable ingredients in the recipe made it easy to customize to different tastes.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were as transposable as a kaleidoscope, shifting rapidly from one color to another.
meanings.sent5: The transposable curtains in the room let in just the right amount of sunlight throughout the day.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to change position or order.
meanings.sent1: The transposable sections of the report allowed us to rearrange the information easily.
meanings.sent2: The transposable cards in the deck made the card game more dynamic and unpredictable.
meanings.sent3: The transposable traffic cones on the road looked like they were doing a coordinated dance.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were as transposable as a Rubik's cube, constantly twisting and turning into new combinations.
meanings.sent5: The transposable keys on the piano created a melody that seemed to flow and shift effortlessly.
